ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 2.48 in New York in 1966
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: You should not be anxious for the success or failure of the attempt you are making. Suppose you are working in a firm selling something. You go out and sincerely work. Suppose one day you get business worth 100,000 dollars, and another day you don't get any business. It doesn't matter, because your connection with the master is there and so you get your salary. When the profit is 100,000 dollars, you don't expect any profit, and when there is no business, there is no loss on your part. Siddhy-asiddhyoh.

I am going to my office to earn some money, because without money, my household affairs could not go on. I am thinking, 'This money is required, otherwise God's service will be stopped.' So while earning money in my office, my God consciousness is there. Therefore, even while earning, whatever the process may be, you are yoga-sthah, situated in yoga. You get some money and go to the market. You are thinking, 'Oh, this is a very nice thing. It can be offered to Lord Kṛṣṇa.' Just like sometimes you bring some fruit for me, thinking, out of your love, 'Swamiji will eat this and he will like it.' Out of love, you think of Swamiji, and Swamiji is thought of because he is in relation with God. So this is God consciousness. It is just like electricity. Anything connected with the powerhouse is surcharged with electricity.
But if you mold your life in such a way that always, twenty-four hours a day, you are in meditation—that is the platform of yoga-sthah kuru karmāņi.

Because my body is dedicated to the service of the Lord, if I don't eat sufficiently to keep my body fit, I won't be able to work. In this way, your eating is also God consciousness. Your sleeping is also God consciousness.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 7.3 in Nairobi in 1975
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: So when we realize that 'I am trying to accumulate so many things, but Kṛṣṇa is taking them away,' then why don't I surrender to Kṛṣṇa so that He may not take away my position? That is siddhi, that 'I am not independent. I am trying independently, but it is not possible. I am dependent. I am an eternal servant of Kṛṣṇa.' That is self-realization.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Śrīmad-Bhāgavatam 7.16 in Hyderabad in 1975
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: By the evolutionary process, the conditioned soul transmigrates from aquatic life to plant life, then insect life, then reptile life, then bird life, then beast life, then the human form of life, then civilized human life, and then a human body born in Bharata-varṣa. To be born in this land of Bharata-varṣa is the highest developed life by the evolutionary process.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 2.39 in London in 1973
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: Because we are subordinate, we must act according to the direction of the master, or the Supreme. That is called buddhi-yoga. When you act according to the direction of the Supreme, Kṛṣṇa, or His representative, it is called buddhi-yoga.

Bhajatāṁ prīti-pūrvakam: always trying to render some service to the Lord. How? Prīti-pūrvakam: 'with love and faith.' Not that 'Oh, I have to do it? All right, let me do it.' No. 'Oh, I have to do it? Let me do it nicely.' Unless there is love, you cannot do anything nicely.

This person has surrendered to Kṛṣṇa after many, many births. If that is the ultimate goal, why shouldn't I surrender immediately? That is buddhi-yoga. 'Why shall I wait for many, many births?' That is buddhi-yoga, intelligent yoga.
As soon as one comes to the point of serving Kṛṣṇa with love, even without any understanding, it will act just like fire. Without making an analytical study of fire, if you touch it, it will act.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 2.40 in Mayapur in 1976
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: If you simply offer your obeisances before the Deity, you will undoubtedly make progress.

Foolish persons think that they are very much advanced and so they have no need to attend ārati, or play the mṛdaṅga or cymbals, but that is not a fact. So many items are given by the ācāryas. If not this, you do this, you do that—hundreds of items. Take any one of them and you'll be benefited. This is arcana-mārga.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda room conversation on Bg 2.41 in Tokyo in 1974
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: Lord Caitanya Mahāprabhu's mission is prithivīte āche yata nagarādi grāma: 'you must preach this cult.' One who is doing this is really a devotee. He may not be a very successful preacher that doesn't matter. Because he is doing this, he is a first-class devotee. That is a real follower. What his predecessor has ordered must be done at any risk. It doesn't matter whether it is being done nicely or not. Because he is attempting to do this, it is sufficient. That very attempt will make him successful. This is the principle. Vyavasāyātmikā buddhiḥ.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda letter referring to Bg 2.41 in Bombay in 1976
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: The real ocean of mercy is Kṛṣṇa and it is the duty of the spiritual master to tell his disciple to come to this ocean and be happy. I am trying my best, and if you try to follow, surely you will benefit.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture in New Vrndāvana in 1969 referring to Bg 2.41
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda
lecture: Lecture on Nārada's instructions for Bg 2.41

statements.statement: Vyavasāyātmikā buddhir ekeha kuru-nandana: 'Those who are on this path are resolute in purpose, and their aim is one.' If that one is the source of everything, one should take that one.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda on Bg chapter 2 verse 39 in London in 1973
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: Because we are subordinate, we must act according to the direction of the master, or the Supreme. That is called buddhi-yoga. When you act according to the direction of the Supreme, Krsna, or His representative, it is called buddhi-yoga.

Bhajatāṁ prīti-pūrvakam: always trying to render some service to the Lord. How? Prīti-pūrvakam: "with love and faith." Not that "Oh, I have to do it? All right, let me do it." No. "Oh, I have to do it? Let me do it nicely." Unless there is love, you cannot do anything nicely.

This person has surrendered to Krsna after many, many births. If that is the ultimate goal, why shouldn't I surrender immediately? That is buddhi-yoga. "Why shall I wait for many, many births?" That is buddhi-yoga, intelligent yoga.
As soon as one comes to the point of serving Krsna with love, even without any understanding, it will act just like fire. Without making an analytical study of fire, if you touch it, it will act.

ref: While lecturing on Śrīmad-Bhāgavatam in Mayapur in 1976, referred to Bg chapter 2 verse 40
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: If you simply offer your obeisances before the Deity, you will undoubtedly make progress.

Foolish persons think that they are very much advanced and so they have no need to attend ārati, or play the mṛdaṅga or cymbals, but that is not a fact. So many items are given by the ācāryas. If not this, you do this, you do that—hundreds of items. Take any one of them and you'll be benefited. This is arcana-marga.

ref: During a room conversation in Tokyo in 1974, referred to Bg verse 2.41
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: Lord Caitanya Mahaprabhu's mission is prithivite achhe yata nagarādi gram: "you must preach this cult." One who is doing this is really a devotee. He may not be a very successful preacher that doesn't matter. Because he is doing this, he is a first-class devotee. That is a real follower. What his predecessor has ordered must be done at any risk. It doesn't matter whether it is being done nicely or not. Because he is attempting to do this, it is sufficient. That very attempt will make him successful. This is the principle. Vyavasāyātmikā buddhih.

ref: In a 1976 letter addressed to My dear Sons and Daughters in Bombay, referred to Bg verse 2.41
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: The real ocean of mercy is Krsna and it is the duty of the spiritual master to tell his disciple to come to this ocean and be happy. I am trying my best, and if you try to follow, surely you will benefit.

ref: While lecturing on Nārada's instructions to Śrīla Vyāsadeva in the First Canto of Śrimad-Bhāgavatam in New Vrndāvana in 1969, referred to Bg verse 2.41
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda
lecture: Lecture on Nārada's instructions for Bg 2.41

statements.statement: Vyavasāyātmikā buddhir ekeha kuru nandana: "Those who are on this path are resolute in purpose, and their aim is one." If that one is the source of everything, one should take that one.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lectured on Bg verse 2.47 in New York in 1966
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: If you don't give engagement to the consciousness on the consciousness plane, then naturally consciousness will act through the body.

One should not think, "Because I am not this body, I shall cease working." No. If you stop working, then your idle brain will become a devil's workshop. Therefore the Lord says, "The technique of acting on the spiritual platform is that you have a right to act according to your position," but mã phaleșu kadācana: "you should not desire to enjoy the fruits of your activities."

Our mind is so inclined that if I cannot enjoy the fruits of my activities, then I am disinclined. There is an English proverb: "Proprietorship turns sand into gold." A person working on his own account can turn sand into gold, but a person working on another's account will be slow. "Why shall I work so hard? The result will be enjoyed by someone else." But here the Lord says, "You cannot stop your work, nor can you enjoy the fruits of your activities." That is work on the spiritual plane.
If your fruitive results are offered to the Supreme Lord, they will be distributed to everyone. That is the spiritual State.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lectured on Bg verse 2.48 in New York in 1966
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: This technique of working on the spiritual platform is explained herewith, siddhy-asiddhyoḥ samo bhūtvä: "You should not be anxious for the success or failure of the attempt you are making." Suppose you are working in a firm selling something. You go out and sincerely work. Suppose one day you get business worth 100,000 dollars, and another day you don't get any business. It doesn't matter, because your connection with the master is there and so you get your salary. When the profit is 100,000 dollars, you don't expect any profit, and when there is no business, there is no loss on your part. Siddhy-asiddhyoh.

I am going to my office to earn some money, because without money, my household affairs could not go on. I am thinking, "This money is required, otherwise God's service will be stopped." So while earning money in my office, my God consciousness is there. Therefore, even while earning, whatever the process may be, you are yoga-sthah, situated in yoga. You get some money and go to the market. You are thinking, "Oh, this is a very nice thing. It can be offered to Lord Krşņa." Just like sometimes you bring some fruit for me, thinking, out of your love, "Swamiji will eat this and he will like it." Out of love, you think of Swamiji, and Swamiji is thought of because he is in relation with God. So this is God consciousness. It is just like electricity. Anything connected with the powerhouse is surcharged with electricity.
But if you mold your life in such a way that always, twenty-four hours a day, you are in meditation—that is the platform of yoga-sthah kuru karmāņi.

Because my body is dedicated to the service of the Lord, if I don't eat sufficiently to keep my body fit, I won't be able to work. In this way, your eating is also God consciousness. Your sleeping is also God consciousness.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lectured on Bg verses 2.49-50 in New York in 1966
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: Buddhi-yoga means devotional service to the Lord. So you have to do everything based on the criterion of buddhi-yoga, or devotional service to the Lord. That is the technique. Dūreṇa hy avaram karma buddhi-yogāt. You have to use your intelligence, "Whether I am doing this on the platform of pure consciousness, or on the platform of this body?" Don't do any work which you cannot do in God consciousness.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lectured on Bg verses 2.52-53 in New York in 1966
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: Therefore the whole thing depends upon how to adjust ourselves to that supreme consciousness. If while performing all the religious rituals very nicely and perfectly, we fail to dovetail ourselves with the supreme consciousness, then all our labor for performing these rituals becomes only a labor of love. It has not produced anything substantial.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lectured on Bg verses 2.55-58 in New York in 1966
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: The first symptom of a self-realized soul is that he doesn't make any plans for his prosperity. I should not make any plan independently, but I must accept the standard plan which is coming directly from the supreme consciousness through a channel.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lectured on Bg verse 2.59 in New York in 1966
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: We have to learn how to see the beauty of spiritual life, and then we will be able to refrain from material activities. We have to be always, cent percent, engaged in spiritual activities. That should be the program of our life.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lectured on Bg verses 2.60-61 in New York in 1966
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: If you simply chant the holy names of the Lord, then everything will by and by come to you automatically.

ref: Bhagavad-gītā 2.60–61 — Lecture by Śrīla Prabhupāda, New York, 1966
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: Without penance and without sacrifice, nobody has attained spiritual perfection. So we require some sort of penance. That penance is to not engage our senses in the process of sense gratification.

The motto of our life: 'I shall not do anything for my sense satisfaction, but I shall do everything for the satisfaction of the Supreme.' That penance, that sacrifice, will make me perfectly spiritualized so that my life becomes perfect.

ref: Bhagavad-gītā 2.67–68 — Lecture by Śrīla Prabhupāda, Los Angeles, 1968
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: If you want to control the senses, then you first have to control the tongue. Then you will be able to control the other senses very easily. Give the tongue the engagement of chanting Hare Kṛṣṇa and tasting Kṛṣṇa prasādam and then you'll find that your other senses are already controlled. This is the key to controlling the senses, but if you allow the tongue indulgence, you'll never be able to control the other senses. This is the secret of controlling the senses.

ref: Bhagavad-gītā 2.41 — Disappearance Day Lecture on Śrīla Bhaktisiddhānta Sarasvatī Ṭhākura by Śrīla Prabhupāda, Los Angeles, 1968
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda
lecture: Disappearance Day Lecture on Śrīla Bhaktisiddhānta Sarasvatī Ṭhākura

statements.statement: If we strictly try to serve the spiritual master, his order, then Kṛṣṇa will give us all facilities. That is the secret. Although I never thought that there was any possibility.
We should try to carry out the specific instruction of the spiritual master very rigidly, without caring for our personal benefit or loss.

ref: Bhagavad-gītā 2.59 — Room Conversation with Śrīla Prabhupāda, New Mayapur, France, 1976
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: In the spiritual world, the service of the Lord is so pleasing that they can neglect sense pleasure. That is spiritual world.

ref: Bhagavad-gītā 3.4–5 — Lecture by Śrīla Prabhupāda, Los Angeles, 1968
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: Simply rejecting will not help you. You must have positive engagement in Kṛṣṇa consciousness.

ref: Bhagavad-gītā 3.6–8 — Lecture by Śrīla Prabhupāda, Los Angeles, 1968
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: You cannot cheat others. Simply for Kṛṣṇa's satisfaction you can beg from others.
One who cannot become cent percent engaged, then all right, become fifty percent, twenty-five percent, or one percent engaged. Give something for Kṛṣṇa. Don't be a miser.

ref: Bhagavad-gītā 3.36–40 — Lecture by Śrīla Prabhupāda, Los Angeles, 1969
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: Engage your senses in Kṛṣṇa conscious activities. Then lust will have no place to attack your senses, or sit on your senses. Engage your mind in Kṛṣṇa. Immediately, lust from the mind will go away. Similarly, apply your intelligence, how to work in Kṛṣṇa consciousness. These are the processes.

ref: Bhagavad-gītā 3.36–37 — Lecture by Śrīla Prabhupāda, Melbourne
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: These boys and girls are engaged in the service of the Lord. They are not ordinary boys. Their reactions of sinful life are finished. Therefore they are so steadily engaged, twenty-four hours, from early in the morning, four o'clock. That is the sign that they are freed from the reactions of all sinful activities. This is the proof.

ref: Bhagavad-gītā 3.41–43 — Lecture by Śrīla Prabhupāda, Los Angeles, 1969
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: Intelligent take to the practice of yoga by intelligently trying to control the senses. But as soon as you come to the spiritual platform, automatically these things are done because your senses, mind, and intelligence are occupied by Kṛṣṇa consciousness.

ref: Bhagavad-gītā 3.42 — Lecture by Śrīla Prabhupāda, Nairobi, 1975
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: He came here for everyone, because he loves everyone.

ref: Bhagavad-gītā 3.42 — Lecture by Śrīla Prabhupāda, London, 1973
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: As my mind is absorbed in some subject matter, my bodily symptoms will appear.

ref: Bhagavad-gītā 4.5–9 — Lecture by Śrīla Prabhupāda, Bombay, 1974
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: If you simply read the Kṛṣṇa book, although it looks like a story, you will become delivered from the clutches of the repetition of birth and death.

The people who are very seriously reading the Kṛṣṇa book and trying to understand Kṛṣṇa will understand. Kṛṣṇa is very kind. As soon as someone begins reading the Kṛṣṇa book with a little faith and adherence, Kṛṣṇa will be very much pleased.
You don't have to search for Kṛṣṇa—He's already within you. Simply you have to become a little serious.
If you are a serious devotee, if you are in love with Kṛṣṇa, then teṣāṁ satata-yuktānāṁ bhajatāṁ prīti-pūrvakam: Kṛṣṇa will reveal Himself to you.

ref: Bhagavad-gītā 4.5–9 — Lecture by Śrīla Prabhupāda, New York, 1966
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: The Lord is very much anxious about saintly persons who have sacrificed everything for His service and so are very, very dear to Him.
The Lord cannot tolerate it when someone misbehaves with a sādhu. Although a sādhu tolerates all insults, the Lord will never tolerate it if a sādhu is insulted or threatened.
There is special protection for the person who is a devotee who is always thinking of Kṛṣṇa in Kṛṣṇa consciousness.
When we acquire transcendental senses, we will see Kṛṣṇa through the Bhagavad-gītā. The Bhagavad-gītā is Kṛṣṇa. Bhagavad-gītā is not different from Kṛṣṇa.
If we chant this vibration of transcendental sound with devotion and attention, it is the highest type of meditation and yoga. And it is very easy.

So anyone who understands this fact, that Kṛṣṇa is not different from the sound Kṛṣṇa, that Kṛṣṇa is not different from the Bhagavad-gītā, and that Kṛṣṇa is not different from anything which is connected with Kṛṣṇa.

ref: Bhagavad-gītā 4.10 — Lecture by Śrīla Prabhupāda, Vṛndāvana, 1974
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: Always think of Kṛṣṇa, man-manāḥ. If you simply think of Kṛṣṇa, if you simply chant the Hare Kṛṣṇa names, you remain man-mayā.
It is understood that those who are thinking of Kṛṣṇa have taken shelter of Kṛṣṇa.
Suffering is there and so why not suffer for Kṛṣṇa?

ref: Bhagavad-gītā 4.11 — Lecture by Śrīla Prabhupāda, New York, 1966
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda
lecture: Lecture on Leadership and Personal Conduct

statements.statement: The leader should be such that he will make the persons following him happy and prosperous.
I have a particular lust within me, and when I find somebody corroborating with that particular lust, I accept him as a leader. That is my position. Therefore I do not follow anyone's leadership.

If you agree to follow the leadership of Kṛṣṇa then proportionately as you follow, you will become perfect. If you follow one percent, you will become one percent perfect. If you follow twenty-five percent, you will become twenty-five percent perfect. And if you follow cent-percent, you will become cent percent perfect.

ref: Bhagavad-gītā 4.14–15 — Lecture by Śrīla Prabhupāda, New York, 1966
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: So accept Kṛṣṇa as your son and He'll be the most obedient son, just as He was playing the part before Yaśodā. Similarly, accept Kṛṣṇa as your husband or lover. You'll never be frustrated. That is the whole philosophy. Whatever desire you have, you can establish a relationship with Kṛṣṇa and you'll be perfectly happy, and never be cheated.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 4.36–38 in New York in 1966
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: When your fire of knowledge is ablaze then sarva-karmāṇi, all reactions to your work will be turned into ashes.
When one is awakened to full knowledge, he understands: 'Oh, I am not happy. I want freedom.'
The knowledge is: 'I am part and parcel of the Supreme Lord. I am individual consciousness and so I should be dovetailed with the Supreme Consciousness.' That is jñāna.

Even the mode of goodness is a cause of our bondage. Therefore we have to transcend even the quality of goodness. That transcendental position is Kṛṣṇa consciousness, and it begins with aham brahmāsmi. 'I am Brahman. I am not matter.'

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 4.39–40 in New York in 1966
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: We must have some faith. When we go to the barber shop, on faith we stretch our neck while the razor is shaving us. The barber may at once put the razor into our neck, but we have faith: 'Yes, we have faith. He'll not do that.' So without faith, we cannot make progress.
The material world is miserable, but for the faithless person it will be more miserable. He'll always feel disturbed and miserable. So for a faithless person, the situation is very precarious.
If we can keep faith in an ordinary bank, can we not keep our faith in Kṛṣṇa?

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda roof conversation referring to Bg 4.11 in Mayapur in 1977
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: This material world means that as long as we'll have even a pinch of material desire, we'll have to take birth. Kṛṣṇa will give us full facility to satisfy our senses in various ways.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Śrīmad-Bhāgavatam referring to Bg 4.34 in New York in 1974
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda
lecture: Lecture on Śrīmad-Bhāgavatam referring to Bg 4.34

statements.statement: The example of surrender is given by Bhaktivinoda Ṭhākura: a dog. The dog fully surrenders to the master. Even if the master kills him, he does not protest. 'Tomāra kukkura bhuliyā jānaha more.'

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 5.4–5 in New York in 1966
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: You should not be rigid. Suppose I have come to certain stage. 'Therefore I'll take it as final.' No. Then there would be no improvement. You have to seek out if there is more and more knowledge beyond this.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 5.6–9 in New York in 1966
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: So without attachment, we cannot actually be detached from this material world.
If I am dovetailed with Kṛṣṇa consciousness then acirena that very soon I shall realize myself as Brahman. It is simply question of realization.
If this material world is utilized for Kṛṣṇa, then there will be no trouble there will be no disturbance of peace.
When I am taking my food, if I think, 'Oh, Kṛṣṇa has kindly sent me this foodstuff,' this is yoga-yukta muni. Muni means one who is thoughtful.
If we always dovetail ourselves in Kṛṣṇa consciousness, and in that way prosecute our duties, at once, very nicely, very easily, we will realize Brahman.
When one dovetails himself in Kṛṣṇa consciousness, then Kṛṣṇa gives him better direction: 'Do like this and then you will come back to me.'

Those who are in Kṛṣṇa consciousness do not expect any result from their work. 'Oh, I am doing this work so that I will enjoy the result.' That never comes into the mind of a person who is Kṛṣṇa conscious. And that is the source of peace. Śāntim āpnoti naiṣṭhikīm. He's always confident that 'I am engaged in Kṛṣṇa's duty, so I am protected. Whatever is the result, I do not mind.'

A criminal is condemned to death or imprisoned. He makes an appeal: 'Oh, please excuse me,' but the judge puts him in jail. He thinks: 'The judge has condemned me to death, or has put me in jail,' but is the judge an enemy of a particular person so that he puts him in jail or condemns him to death? No. The criminal has created his jail life. The judge is simply giving him the direction: 'Oh, you have done this. Now you have to go to jail.' He is not responsible.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 5.23–26 in New York in 1966
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: We have to mold our lives in such a way that we should be able to tolerate, without training, nothing can be done.

Happiness is your prerogative. That is your life, but happiness in the diseased condition is not happiness. That we must understand. So we have to cure this diseased condition and then enjoy pleasure that will be unlimited. Real happiness is unending.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 5.23–26 in Los Angeles in 1969
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: By chanting and dancing, we derive a thousand times greater beneficial result than that which is attained by those practices.

Begin this Kṛṣṇa consciousness chanting. You will feel: 'Yes, I am getting spiritual strength.' Is it not a fact? If somebody is disturbed, then it is to be understood that his disease is a little more acute.

If you are chanting within this room and if you find that nobody is coming to participate in the kīrtana, don't be disappointed. There are many germs, worms, and cockroaches within this room and they are being benefited.
If one hears for one day, one minute, or even one second, this vibration of chanting will someday act.
Even if you are very expert in committing sinful activities, this will finish the reactions, provided it is chanted offenselessly. It has such power.
Self-discipline means not to identify with this body.

Self-realization means that I am not this body, I am spirit soul. That is self-realization. So if I am smaller than the grass and if somebody says, 'You are lower than the grass,' then that's a fact. Sometimes insulting words may come from others, but if you are self-realized, you will know that you are not this body. So let them insult me. Let me tolerate.

Caitanya Mahāprabhu teaches taror api sahiṣṇunā: toleration like a tree. You cannot find any living entity more tolerant than a tree because it is standing day and night in the scorching heat, or in severe cold, or when there is wind, or when there is rainfall, and it does not protest. People are taking leaves, flowers, and fruits, and they are cutting it, but it never protests. This is a symbol of toleration.
Caitanya Mahāprabhu recommends that you become more tolerant than the tree and smaller than the grass on the street, and that you give all honor to others and don't expect any honor for yourself.
Real honor is when I call you a servant of God, or a servant of Kṛṣṇa.

Always be situated in the self-realized condition that I am not this body. This is perfection. But due to my ignorance, I am identifying with the body and therefore I am not self-realized. Therefore, constantly endeavoring. This cannot be attained all of a sudden. One has to practice. That is Kṛṣṇa conscious practice.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 5.29 in New York in 1966
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: But if we think, 'It is all Kṛṣṇa's property. Let us enjoy it and be Kṛṣṇa conscious and be happy,' then there would be no disturbance. Automatically, peace would be there.
Suppose I am transmigrating to the body of a hog. Kṛṣṇa is also present there. He's such a friend.
Kṛṣṇa is such a good friend that in whatever condition you may live, He is always with you.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 5.29 in Los Angeles in 1969
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: To live the life of celibacy is called brahmacarya. It has such a nice effect that if anyone from birth to death simply observes a life of celibacy, he is sure to go back to home.

If you are engaged in Kṛṣṇa's service, do you think that you will starve? You cannot starve. He is the well-wisher of all living entities. Why not of you? This confidence must be there. If He is well-wisher of everyone and if I am engaged in His service, is He not my well-wisher?

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 6.7-9 in New York in 1966
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: The duality of distress and happiness is due to the skin. This is skin disease. It's just like itching. Even though there is itching, I should not become mad after it. I should tolerate it.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 6.11-15 in New York in 1966
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: A man who is always disturbed in mind cannot perform yoga. And vigata-bhīh. Bhīh means fearfulness. If one is afraid then how can he go out of home and stay in the jungle? That is not possible. That is another qualification for executing yoga. Not only yoga. Any person who is trying to elevate himself in the spiritual line has to become fearless.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 6.11-15 in Los Angeles in 1969
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: So to refrain from sex life is so powerful. Even if you don't do anything else, if you simply restrain your sex life, you will become a very powerful man. People do not know this secret. Anything you do, if you want to do it with determination, you have to stop sex life. That is the secret.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 6.16-18 in New York in 1966
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: If anyone dreams very much, he also cannot execute yoga. Here Śrī Kṛṣṇa does not say that there is dreamless sleep. Dreamless sleep is impossible. If somebody says, 'dreamless sleep,' it is another lunacy. As soon as you are asleep, dreams must be there. There may be good dreams or bad dreams, for a long time or for a little time, but dreams must be there. Now Kṛṣṇa says, na ca ati svapna-śīlasya. That means: 'One who dreams very much while sleeping cannot execute yoga.' Na jāgrato naiva cārjuna. 'And one who cannot sleep at night also cannot practice yoga.'
And if you keep yourself peaceful, with a cool mind, cool head, and cool stomach, then there will be ordinary sleep.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 6.20-23 in New York in 1966
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: We may have many dangerous situations in material life, but if we are preparing ourselves for going back to Kṛṣṇa in Kṛṣṇa consciousness, then these things will not be cared for. Let them happen. Agamāpāyinah anityās tāṁs titikṣasva bhārata. They come and they go. Let them happen. The bombing was not for all days. All right, let it take place for a few hours, or a few days. That is the technique for not being disturbed. The more we advance in Kṛṣṇa consciousness, the more we become free from material entanglement.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 6.24 in Los Angeles in 1969
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: Determination can actually be attained by one who does not indulge in sex life. His determination is strong. Therefore in the beginning it was said, 'without sex life.' Or controlled sex life. If you indulge in sex life then determination will not come—only flickering determination. Therefore sex life should be controlled or given up. If it is possible, one should give it up altogether, and if not, it should be controlled. Then you'll get determination, because after all, determination is a bodily affair.

Determination means that one has to continue with patience and perseverance. I'm not getting the desired result. 'Oh what is this Kṛṣṇa consciousness? I shall give up.' No. Determination. It is a fact. Because Kṛṣṇa is saying this, it must happen.
If I eat more, if I use my tongue unnecessarily, if I allow my mind to do anything and everything, then I also can't check my genital.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 6.24-28 in New York in 1966
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: We have to always think of controlling the senses. With mind being fixed up in the Supersoul.
If you follow the rules and regulations, then the agitated mind will gradually come under your control.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda letter in 1972
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: Good things don't come so easily.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 6.40-45 in New York in 1966
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: I may tell you that those who have very seriously taken to this society, Kṛṣṇa consciousness, are not ordinary persons. They must have had such cultivation in their previous life. Now they are trying to revive the same thing.

It is just like somebody forcing: 'Take this!' Another example is that one who is pious is forced to cultivate spiritual life and make progress, because God is within you. Sarvasya cāhaṁ hṛdi sanniviṣṭaḥ. He is seated in everyone's heart. Mattaḥ smṛtir jñānam. He gives reminders: 'You missed this point from here. Now, come on. Begin again. Become perfect. Don't lose this chance.' He is so kind.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 7.1-2 in Ahmedabad in 1972
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: This Kṛṣṇa consciousness movement wants to see that every house has a temple of Kṛṣṇa. That is our program.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 7.8-11 in Bombay in 1971
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: It is not by your eyes that you can see Him, but if you follow the prescription, you will see Kṛṣṇa twenty-four hours a day.

When one is an elevated devotee, a mahā-bhāgavata, he does not see anything but Kṛṣṇa. Sthāvara-jaṅgama dekhe na dekhe tāra mūrti. He is on the seaside, but he is not seeing the sea—he is seeing Kṛṣṇa. He's seeing how Kṛṣṇa's energy is working—that it is producing such a vast ocean. He is thinking like that. That is meditation. Anywhere he goes, he simply thinks of Kṛṣṇa. This is called Kṛṣṇa consciousness.

As you go on hearing, the dirty things in the heart will become clear. This hearing process is so nice. If you simply hear about Kṛṣṇa, and if you try to understand Kṛṣṇa as directed by Kṛṣṇa, then Kṛṣṇa will cooperate with you. Just like when a teacher sees that a student is very intelligent and following his directions, he takes more interest in him. That is natural.

Simply by eating kṛṣṇa-prasādam, even without reading any Vedic literature, and without even reading Bhagavad-gītā, if you simply think of Kṛṣṇa: 'How nicely Kṛṣṇa has tasted this foodstuff,' you will become Kṛṣṇa conscious.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 7.8 in Bombay in 1974
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: This Hare Kṛṣṇa mantra should be chanted twenty-four hours a day—kīrtanīyaḥ sadā hariḥ. But if it becomes difficult or hackneyed, then you can remember Kṛṣṇa in other ways—while drinking water, while seeing the sunshine, while seeing the moonshine, while chanting Vedic mantras, or even while hearing some sound in the sky.

Sound is produced in the ether. We are hearing so many sounds. The Hare Kṛṣṇa sound is transcendental. That's all right, but if you don't like Hare Kṛṣṇa, then take any sound. Any sound is also coming from the original sound. Simply it is covered by māyā.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 7.8-11 in New York in 1966
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: We can see God at every step. Any kind of penance, any kind of perseverance is also God.
Desire without attraction means Kṛṣṇa consciousness. I desire for Kṛṣṇa's benefit, not for my personal benefit. That is desire without attraction.

If we really want happiness, then we must accept tapasya. If you think, 'Without tapasya, I can get it simply by imagination,' then you become a sahajiyā. That acceptance of tapasya means that you associate with Kṛṣṇa.

Thinking of Kṛṣṇa twenty-four hours a day is very pleasing, but for those who are materially attached and cannot continually think of Him, Kṛṣṇa is prescribing: 'See the varieties of this material world and try to remember Me.'
Drink water and remember Kṛṣṇa. See the light and remember Kṛṣṇa. Experience the aroma of a very nice flower—puṇya gandhaḥ—and immediately remember Kṛṣṇa. Practice this. It is not difficult.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda reference to Bg 7.14 in unknown Śrīmad-Bhāgavatam lecture
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: Laws of material nature, or the material nature itself, is working under the direction of God. Just like how a police force is working under the direction of the government.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda reference to Bg 7.16 in Hyderabad in 1975
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: To be born in this land of Bhārata-varṣa is the highest developed life by the evolutionary process.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 7.25 in Bombay in 1971
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: Those who are engaged in pure devotional service can see Kṛṣṇa at every moment. Santaḥ sadaiva hṛdayeṣu vilokayanti. That is the process.
People are rotting in this material world because they have forgotten Kṛṣṇa. This is the only reason.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 7.26 in Hyderabad in 1976
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: Kṛṣṇa knows past, present, and future. We do not even know what will happen tonight. But Kṛṣṇa knows.
We may forget, but Kṛṣṇa does not forget. He remains the witness.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 7.28 in Bombay in 1971
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: Only those who are pious and whose sinful reactions are completely eradicated can be engaged in devotional service with determination.
We have to become free from sinful activities by devotional service. That is the process.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 7.29 in London in 1973
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: If one actually wants liberation, he must engage in devotional service to Kṛṣṇa. Without bhakti, liberation is not possible.
Others may speculate or meditate for many lifetimes, but unless they surrender to Kṛṣṇa, they cannot attain liberation.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 7.30 in London in 1973
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: Those who are completely engaged in devotional service know Me as the Supreme Personality of Godhead and know everything about the material and spiritual worlds.
Without being a pure devotee, one cannot understand the ultimate cause—Kṛṣṇa.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 8.5 in Geneva in 1974
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: At any moment, you can die. There is no guarantee when you will die, but it is guaranteed that you must die. Therefore we must be prepared for death at any moment.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 8.8 (referenced) in Los Angeles in 1972
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: Don't allow anything else to enter your mind. This requires a little practice—abhyāsa-yoga-yuktena cetasā nānya-gāminā. I should not allow my mind to think of any other subject than Kṛṣṇa.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 8.14-15 in New York in 1966
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: Now I am in America but that does not mean that I am out of Vṛndāvana. Because if I think of Kṛṣṇa always, it is as good as if I were in Vṛndāvana. The consciousness is there. So Kṛṣṇa consciousness means that you already live with Kṛṣṇa in His spiritual planet. You simply have to wait for giving up this body.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 8.20-21 in New York in 1966
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: You have to believe Bhagavad-gītā. There is no possibility of experimental knowledge. And if you become advanced in Kṛṣṇa consciousness, you'll realise this. Whatever we are speaking, we are firmly convinced of its truth.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 8.23-27 in New York in 1966
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: While you are walking on the street, if you are chanting Hare Kṛṣṇa, then Kṛṣṇa is going with you.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda room conversation referencing Bg 8.6 in Vṛndāvana in 1974
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: If you remember Kṛṣṇa, then your life is successful. Therefore we require bhajana-smaraṇam, always chanting Hare Kṛṣṇa, Hare Kṛṣṇa so that we may get the chance of remembering Kṛṣṇa at the time of death. Then our life will be successful.

If at the time of death one chants Hare Kṛṣṇa then you can know for certain that he has gone to Vaikuṇṭha. There is no doubt about this. Even if there was aparādha, it is not taken into consideration, because at the time of death he has uttered the holy name. This is a special consideration. Anta-kāle.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 9.2 in Calcutta in 1972
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: This Hare Kṛṣṇa mahā-mantra teaches us how to think of Kṛṣṇa twenty-four hours a day.
We receive so many letters from our foreign students about how they're feeling. Because they have taken it seriously, they're feeling obliged that 'We have life.'

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 9.2 in Melbourne in 1976
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: This material world is dark, but to give us little relief, Kṛṣṇa, God, has given us the sun.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 9.2 in Calcutta in 1972
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: This Hare Kṛṣṇa mahā-mantra teaches us how to think of Kṛṣṇa twenty-four hours a day.
We receive so many letters from our foreign students about how they're feeling. Because they have taken it seriously, they're feeling obliged that 'We have life.'

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 9.2 in Melbourne in 1976
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: This material world is dark, but to give us little relief, Kṛṣṇa, God, has given us the sun.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 9.4-6 in New York in 1966
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: If we make image of God from stone, it's not a doll. It is also God. If we have sufficient devotion, that image will speak with us, because God is everywhere.
The result will be that if you offer your devotion, this image or incarnation of arca will respond.
When his devotee is there, He can manifest Himself anywhere and everywhere, but when there is no devotee, He is not there, although His energy is there.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 9.4-6 in Melbourne in 1976
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: Everyone is existing on My energy, but still, I am not there. 'I am not there' means that the living entity has forgotten or can't understand that he is within God's energy.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 9.13-14 in New York in 1966
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: To become Brahman means that we have to work with superior endeavour and superior energy from a superior position.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 9.13-14 in Hawaii in 1975
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: So those who are trying to be idle Kṛṣṇa-bhaktas are not devotees. One must be engaged in Kṛṣṇa's work. That is devotion.
He's always engaged in My service. That is mahātmā.

Kṛṣṇa said, 'You should remember Me and at the same time fight.' He never said, 'Simply fight' or 'Simply chant,' because in the material world, that is not possible. Therefore chanting must be there, and at the same time you have to work to continue this movement. The movement requires energy.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 9.22-25 in New York in 1966
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: Happiness is within your mind. If you are assured of your peaceful existence and that in next life you will be transferred to Supreme planet—that is happiness.
Kṛṣṇa assures that one who is always engaged in Kṛṣṇa consciousness: He will be happy, because I will supply him whatever he requires.
Kṛṣṇa is anxious for all living entities, but He is especially anxious for His devotees.
So for persons who are completely in Kṛṣṇa consciousness, there is no scarcity.

If you take this advantage of chanting HARE KṚṢṆA HARE KṚṢṆA KṚṢṆA KṚṢṆA HARE HARE, HARE RĀMA HARE RĀMA RĀMA RĀMA HARE HARE, in whatever position you may be in, you will never be unhappy. You will always be prosperous.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 9.26-28 in New York in 1966
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: We can't claim any favour from the Supreme unless we are in love.
Your love means that you should offer to Kṛṣṇa the nicest, the choicest, the best things.
The Supreme Lord is full. He doesn't require your offering, but He likes that you offer Him something.
If I offer Him something, then I become a pet son of my father. This is called bhakti.
God is very intelligent. Once you engage yourself in Kṛṣṇa consciousness, there is no way out. He is so kind.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 9.29 in New York in 1966
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: Even if there is no love, if you, under the prescribed rules and regulations, simply render service, then you will develop love.
If you do a little thing for the service of the Lord, it is noted in the notebook of Kṛṣṇa.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 9.34 in New York in 1966
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: With love, with respect, with designated duties, if you are engaged in Kṛṣṇa consciousness then your life will be successful.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 9.34 in New Mayapur, France in 1976
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: You are worshiping the deity and you are thinking of loving some woman. That means that you are not yet convinced that by loving Kṛṣṇa you'll become perfect. That is the difficulty.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda room conversation on Bg 9.27 with George Harrison in London in 1973
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: You are all qualified artists, so by your art, even on material platform, you get so much adoration. Similarly, if you work on the spiritual platform with the same art, the material adoration will be finished with the finishing of this body, but the spiritual adoration, if you are recognized by Kṛṣṇa, will go with you.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 10.1-2 in Calcutta in 1973
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: Unless one is very strong in his determination, he cannot make any advancement in Kṛṣṇa consciousness. He must be a hero. He must be able to fight with the laws of material nature.
Bhagavad-gītā means, two words: surrender to Kṛṣṇa.

Even Kṛṣṇa Himself does not know His actual position, because He is so great. To understand Himself, Kṛṣṇa came as Caitanya Mahāprabhu, a devotee of Kṛṣṇa, because He wanted to know Himself and He could do so in the attitude of Rādhārāṇī. Therefore He took the attitude of Rādhārāṇī. Therefore Rādhārāṇī-Kṛṣṇa, when combined together, is Lord Caitanya Mahāprabhu.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 10.1-2 in New York in 1966
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: If Kṛṣṇa becomes your friend and well-wisher then what more do you want? We have already described Kṛṣṇa as possessing all riches, all strength, all knowledge, all beauty, all fame, and all renunciation. So if He becomes your well-wisher, what more do you want? A friend can sacrifice everything for a friend, and here is a friend with no limitations.
If you don't take botheration of understanding God then you'll never be happy, nor will you be liberated.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 10.4-5 in New York in 1967
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: Jñānam asammohaḥ. Asammohaḥ means that if you want to acquire knowledge, you should acquire it slowly but very surely, step by step. Don't be impatient, and don't blindly accept something, thinking, 'I have all knowledge; finished.'

You should give all kinds of honor to the foolish creatures that disturb you. Give all kinds of honor to those who identify with the body: 'Oh sir, you are very beautiful. You are very learned.' So that he may not disturb you, give him all kinds of honor.

As soon as you take to spiritual life, there will be so many disturbances because it is a declaration of war against the illusory energy. So as soon as you become Kṛṣṇa conscious, the illusory energy sees: 'Oh, this man is going out of my control. Give him all kinds of impediments.' Therefore you have to learn tolerance.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 10.8 in New York in 1967
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: One must be very well-versed and at the same time completely merged in spiritual emotion, bhāva.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on SB referencing Bg 10.8 and 10.9 in Vṛndāvana in 1975
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: Kṛṣṇa does not accept your service if it is not done with great love and affection.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 4. in Bombay in 1974 (reference to Bg 10.10)
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda
lecture: Lecture on Bg Chapter 4 (reference to Bg 10.10)

statements.statement: As soon as one begins reading Kṛṣṇa book with a little faith and adherence, Kṛṣṇa will be very much pleased. Kṛṣṇa is within your heart and so when you read Bhagavad-gītā or Kṛṣṇa book with a little seriousness, then Kṛṣṇa understands: 'Now he is serious to understand Me.'

Simply you have to become a little serious, 'Kṛṣṇa, kindly give me knowledge so that I can understand You.' If you are a serious devotee, if you are in love with Kṛṣṇa, *teṣāṁ satata-yuktānāṁ bhajatāṁ prīti-pūrvakam, dadāmi buddhi-yogaṁ tam yena mām upayānti te.* *Prīti-pūrvakam.* Love is the basic principle for understanding Kṛṣṇa.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda initiation lecture in Hyderabad in 1976 (reference to Bg 10.11)
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: Always pray to Kṛṣṇa: 'Kṛṣṇa, I have taken shelter of You. Kindly guide me.'

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture referencing Bg 11.55 in New York in 1966
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda
lecture: Lecture on Bg Chapter 4 (reference to Bg 11.55)

statements.statement: We have to perform our activities so nicely and so cautiously that we may not be entangled.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 12.13–14 in Bombay in 1974
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: One who is actually a devotee and wants to be very dear to Me must be adveṣṭā sarva-bhūtānām, non-envious of all living entities.

A devotee is kind to everyone. It is not that Kṛṣṇa consciousness should be spread only in India, or only amongst the brāhmaṇas or amongst the Hindus. A Kṛṣṇa conscious person will preach Kṛṣṇa consciousness all over the world, as far as possible. That is called karuṇāḥ.
Mind and intelligence are always focused on the form of Kṛṣṇa. That is real meditation.

Deity worship is very important. If you are engaged in Deity worship, you always get the impression of Kṛṣṇa and Rādhārāṇī. And if you always think of Kṛṣṇa and Rādhārāṇī within your heart then you become the topmost yogī.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 13.1–3 in Paris in 1973
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: Only Kṛṣṇa is the enjoyer, and if we cooperate with Him, then through His enjoyment, we can also enjoy. That is our position. That is real knowledge.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 13.8–12 in Bombay in 1973
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: Kṛṣṇa says that in the process of acquiring knowledge, one must be very humble and meek. This is the first qualification. This is sattva-guṇa, because those who are situated in rajo-guṇa and tamo-guṇa cannot become humble.
Śaucam, cleanliness, is very essential. As soon as you give up the cleanliness, you become a mleccha and yavana.

Bāhyābhyantaram. Bāhya means that externally you have to cleanse yourself with water, soap, or earth. And internally you have to be cleansed by chanting the Hare Kṛṣṇa mahā-mantra, because if you remain unclean within the heart, simply washing your external body and cleansing your cloth will not be complete cleanliness. That may be called hygienic, but real cleanliness means both internally and externally. Remembering, yaḥ smaret puṇḍarīkākṣam, lotus-eyed Kṛṣṇa, is śuci.
We have to always glorify Kṛṣṇa.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 13.13–18 in Bombay in 1973
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: The aim of life, to become immortal. One has to come to that platform of knowledge where one can achieve the perfection of life, which is amṛtatva, immortality.
Kṛṣṇa says jñeyaṁ yat tat pravakṣyāmi: 'I will explain to you the ultimate goal of knowledge.' Yaj jñātvā: 'If you can understand that knowledge,' then amṛtam aśnute, 'you become immortal.'

Who can be heavier than Kṛṣṇa? Kṛṣṇa proved this when He was a boy of seven and lifted Govardhana Hill, and it continually rested on His finger for seven days. Just imagine how heavy He is. If we understand Kṛṣṇa in that spirit, we become perfect.
The bluish reflection in the sky. It means that the brahmajyoti is bluish because it is coming from the blue body of Kṛṣṇa.
The universe is covered seven times by different types of material elements, and the brahmajyoti is penetrating through those coverings so that we see a little reflection in the sky.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Śrīmad-Bhāgavatam referencing Bg 13.15 in London in 1973
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: If you are actually sincere in your service to Kṛṣṇa then He has agents everywhere.
Sarvataḥ pāni-pādam tat. He has hands and legs everywhere. Wherever He orders, things will come. Simply we have to become sincere and then everything will be there.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 14.1–4 in Bombay in 1974
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: Just like a child is born... the father gives the seed, and the mother gives the body. Similarly, all living entities, in all different species of life, are born of the material nature, but the seed-giving father is Kṛṣṇa.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 14.5 in Bombay in 1974
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: Daivī prakṛti means devotional service. One who is under the control of daivī prakṛti, they are not under the control of these material modes. That is called mukti.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Śrīmad-Bhāgavatam referencing Bg 14.18 in Seattle in 1968
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: If you keep yourself in the modes of goodness, then you get more and more spiritual power.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda letter referencing Bg 15.12 and 15.13 in 1972
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: So even for maintaining your body, you have to take the help of Krsna. You cannot maintain your body independently that is not possible.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture referencing Bg 15.14 in India, date unknown
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: Unless God eats, you cannot eat; unless God sees, you cannot see; and unless God walks, you cannot walk. We are completely dependent, but falsely we claim that these are our eyes.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 15.15 in New Mayapur in 1976
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: Knowledge given by the Paramātmā from within the core of the heart is explained by modern scientists as intuition, or instinct. They do not know wherefrom intuition comes that it is coming from God.
We have come to this material world. Just as we may purchase a machine for some enjoyment, we have fallen down to this material world for some material pleasure.

Krşņa has given us a literature. If you are guided by the literature, your propensity to enjoy the material world will be fulfilled, and at the same time you'll be able to go back home, back to Godhead.
So long as you'll seek your own pleasure, you'll suffer. And when you seek Krsna's pleasure, you'll enjoy.

Service means that you must take orders from the master. That is service. Otherwise it is mental concoction. The servant requests: 'How can I serve you?' So when the master orders: 'You serve me like this,' and you do it-that is service. And if you manufacture your service that is not service. That is your sense gratification

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Śrīmad-Bhāgavatam referencing Bg 15.15 in San Francisco in 1969
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: And if you want to become a first-class devotee, Krsna will give you intelligence how you can become a first-class devotee

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 16.4–5 in Hawaii in 1975
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: If one is proud after becoming a pure servant of Kṛṣṇa; that is very good. That dambha, that pride, is very glorious. 'I am a servant of Kṛṣṇa.' That is very nice.
If you become proud in daivī sampad, by becoming the most confidential servant of Kṛṣṇa, that pride is for your liberation.
First of all we must decide what we want. Whatever you want, you will have. Kṛṣṇa is very kind.
If we desire to become something unlimitedly, Kṛṣṇa can supply us our necessities unlimitedly. Ye yathā māṁ prapadyante.
Kṛṣṇa's pleasure is that whatever you want, you can get.
Kṛṣṇa is very much pleased with the devotees. Therefore His supplies are immediate.
Kṛṣṇa is also kind to the non-devotees. Whatever they want, He will give them, but the necessities of the devotee are the first consideration for Kṛṣṇa.
We should not allow our demonic desires to grow. That is called tapasya. We should sacrifice our desires. That is called sacrifice.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 16.7 in Tokyo in 1975
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: What things we should accept and what things we should reject. That we must learn. Therefore we have so many books.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 16.7 in Hawaii in 1975
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: By nature's arrangement, if you take well water, it is warm early in the morning. You can very easily take your bath. This is called naimitti.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 16.9–10 in Hawaii in 1975
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: Sometimes we enjoy subtle pleasure by thinking of sex life, that is called subtle sex-thinking. Gross sex and subtle sex, so one has to become completely freed from these lusty desires so as not to become implicated in that which will never be satisfied—duṣpūram.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 16.11–12 in Hawaii in 1975
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: Along with anything you do in the material world, there will be cintā, anxiety.

In our Kṛṣṇa consciousness movement, all the activities are spiritual, but still, because they are being enacted in the material world we also have so much anxiety, although that anxiety is also bhakti.
Spiritual anxiety means that you are advancing in spiritual life, and material anxiety means that you are going downhill.

The demons' anxiety is unlimited. You'll find that big, big businessmen have very, very lengthy projects: 'How to increase this factory? How to make it world-renowned?' and so on. There is no limit to their anxiety. Cintām aparimeyāṁ ca.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 16.13–15 in Hawaii in 1975
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: How much I have increased my love for Kṛṣṇa. That is bhakti.
It is Kṛṣṇa's desire. I have some defect and He is correcting me. That is the topmost devotee's conception.

He knows that nobody can become my enemy unless Kṛṣṇa desires it, and so why shall I think of him as my enemy? Kṛṣṇa has desired him to act as my enemy just to correct me, to make me more advanced in spiritual life.
That āśā, that hope, that expectation, that devotion in separation, will lead us to the topmost platform of devotion.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Cc Adi 1.1 in New York in 1976
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: By the mercy of the guru, we get prema-bhakti.
When we are practiced in vidhi-mārga, we gradually develop love of Godhead. In the beginning there must be regulative principles.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 17.1–3 in Honolulu in 1974
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: Without coming to the platform of sattva-guṇa, nobody can advance in spiritual life.
Sattva-guṇa is the best quality. One’s brain becomes clear and one can see things as they are.
Those who believe the body is everything and there is no owner are below the mode of ignorance (tamo-guṇa).
God realization must stick to the principles of sattva-guṇa. Otherwise, it will take a very long time.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 18.5 in London on Rādhāṣṭamī in 1973
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: Kṛṣṇa’s complexion is like a blackish cloud, very, very beautiful. Millions of Cupids cannot compare to Him.
The first expansion is called avatāra, and when there is another avatāra from an avatāra, that is called kalā.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 18.45 in Durban in 1975
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: However you may render service to your family or friends, they will never be satisfied. Rather, they may kill you.

speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: Tattvataḥ: to understand Kṛṣṇa in truth. It is described three times in Bhagavad-gītā.

speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: If you act according to the order of God, He is responsible. If you act against His will, you are responsible.

speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: Man-manā bhava mad-bhakto mad-yājī māṁ namaskuru. This is the beginning of prema.
Thinking of Kṛṣṇa increases your prema for Him.
By hearing and chanting (śravaṇa-kīrtana), Kṛṣṇa-prema will automatically arise.
Because you are My devotee, I want you to be benefited.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 18.66 in London in 1971
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: Simply surrender unto Me and I shall give you all protection. Mā śucah, 'Don't bother.'

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 18.67–69 in Ahmedabad in 1972
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: To come to the platform of devotional service, one has to make some sacrifice.
I shall not speak anything beyond what Kṛṣṇa has spoken—that is tapasya.
To turn one man to Kṛṣṇa consciousness, we have to shed a hundred tons of blood.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda lecture on Bg 1.1 in London in 1973
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: If you are a devotee of Kṛṣṇa, you will get so much power, much more than mystic yoga.

speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: Even a śūdra can get perfection if he performs his work perfectly as devotional service to Kṛṣṇa.

speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement:
Prabhupāda: "These people, they have no illicit sex, no intoxication?" Oh, immediately they become praising, "Such wonderful men. No illicit sex?" [laughs] — which is unknown to you, the Western people.
Puṣṭa Kṛṣṇa: "They think it is like Superman."
Prabhupāda: "Yes. Superman, actually. That is the fact."

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda letter to Upendra in Delhi on December 8, 1971
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement: If a man qualifies for that body, he may be rewarded the body of superman, as he desires. If someone wants such a body, he must learn the process for acquiring it — that is Bhagavad-gītā.

ref: Śrīmad-Bhāgavatam 8.19.24 — Purport by Śrīla Prabhupāda
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement:
Real happiness is described in Bhagavad-gītā (6.21):

sukham ātyantikaṁ yat tad
buddhi-grāhyam atīndriyam
vetti yatra na caivāyaṁ
sthitaś calati tattvataḥ

'In the spiritually joyous state, one is situated in boundless transcendental happiness and enjoys himself through transcendental senses. Established thus, one never departs from the truth.' One has to perceive happiness by the supersenses, which are not the senses of the material elements.

ref: Śrīmad-Bhāgavatam 3.1.43 — Purport by Śrīla Prabhupāda
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement:
If you want to become famous as the hero of the battlefield and thus enjoy the booty of war, then, O Savyasācī, just become the immediate cause of this killing and thus take the credit. I have already killed all the great warriors — Bhīṣma, Droṇa, Jayadratha, Karṇa and many other great generals. Do not worry. Fight the battle and be famous as a great hero.” (Bg. 11.32-34)

The Lord always wants to see His devotee as the hero of some episode which He Himself performs. He wanted to see His devotee and friend Arjuna as the hero of the Battle of Kurukṣetra, and thus He waited for all the miscreants of the world to assemble. That, and nothing else, is the explanation of His waiting.

ref: Śrīmad-Bhāgavatam 4.9.50 — Translation and Purport by Śrīla Prabhupāda
speaker: Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement:
payaḥ stanābhyāṁ susrāva
netra-jaiḥ salilaiḥ śivaiḥ
tadābhiṣicyamānābhyāṁ
vīra vīra-suvo muhuḥ

Translation:
My dear Vidura, Sunīti was the mother of a great hero. Her tears, together with the milk flowing from her breasts, wet the whole body of Dhruva Mahārāja. This was a great, auspicious sign.

Purport:
When Deities are installed, They are washed with milk, yogurt and water, and this ceremony is called abhiṣeka. In this verse it has been especially mentioned that the tears which flowed down from the eyes of Sunīti were all-auspicious. This auspiciousness of the abhiṣeka ceremony performed by his beloved mother was an indication that in the very near future Dhruva Mahārāja would be installed on the throne of his father.

It is also significant in this verse that Sunīti, mother of Dhruva Mahārāja, is described as vīra-sū, a mother who produced a great hero. There are many heroes in the world, but there is no comparison to Dhruva Mahārāja, who was not only a heroic emperor of this planet, but also a great devotee. A devotee is also a great hero because he conquers the influence of māyā.

When Lord Caitanya inquired from Rāmānanda Rāya about the most famous man in this world, the latter replied that anyone who is known as a great devotee of the Lord is to be accepted as the most famous.

ref: THE ONE MAN - ISKCON in the 1970s by Satsvarupa Dasa Goswami
speaker: Satsvarupa Dasa Goswami

statements.statement:
A devotee: we were being offered donations of land in different places.
Prabhupāda: Yes, take them. We can open a center with just one man, as I did in the beginning. He can go to the villages as Lord Caitanya wanted, everywhere. One man can go and sit and talk of Krishna and collect locally.
Satsvarupa Dasa Goswami:He spoke of how the British ruled India with only two hundred top men in India. All the subordinates were Indians. The one man we send, however, has to be without desires for sense gratification.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda – Introduction to Bhagavad-gītā

statements.statement: Unless one reads the Bhagavad-gītā in a submissive spirit, it is very difficult to understand Bhagavad-gītā because it is a great mystery.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda – Śrīmad-Bhāgavatam 1.5.18–19

statements.statement: Even a dog can be liberated simply by being with devotees.
Kṛṣṇa consciousness is like hot sugarcane juice—very sweet but it burns if not handled carefully.
Once someone sincerely surrenders and says, 'Kṛṣṇa, I am Yours,' then Kṛṣṇa will never leave him. He will protect you. If he becomes a little stronger, then there is no question of falling down.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda – Cc Introduction

statements.statement: In this material world sex is required to produce children, but in the spiritual world a man can produce as many children as he likes without having to take help from his wife.
Material energy is dependent on certain laws, but spiritual energy is fully independent.

We cannot imagine how things work in the spiritual world. It is not that Kṛṣṇa does not eat or that we imagine He eats; He actually eats, but His eating is different from ours. Our eating process will be similar to His when we are completely on the spiritual platform.

Although one may complain that no kalpa-vṛkṣa, wish-fulfilling trees, exist there, when the Gosvāmīs were there, kalpa-vṛkṣa were present. It is not that one can simply go to such a tree and make demands; one must first become a devotee.

The Gosvāmīs would live under a tree for one night only, and the trees would satisfy all their desires. For the common man this may all seem very wonderful, but as one makes progress in devotional service, all this can be realized.

ref: Śrīla Prabhupāda-līlāmṛta – Introduction

statements.statement: From childhood, Śrīla Prabhupāda worshiped Lord Kṛṣṇa, understanding Him to be the Supreme Personality of Godhead, the source of all existence. And beginning at age twenty-two, after his first meeting with his spiritual master, Śrīla Bhaktisiddhānta Sarasvatī Ṭhākura, he became more and more active in spreading the teachings of Lord Kṛṣṇa.

Working alone in Jhansi, India, Śrīla Prabhupāda gathered a few part-time followers to create the League of Devotees, an early attempt to introduce people from all nations, races, and levels of society to Kṛṣṇa, the Supreme Personality of Godhead.

Śrīla Prabhupāda arrived in America in 1965 alone, but filled with faith in Kṛṣṇa and determination to fulfill the desire of his spiritual master. Beginning from a small storefront, he introduced the Hare Kṛṣṇa movement to America.
In May of 1967 he appeared to suffer a heart attack and retired to India to recuperate. It became clear that the Kṛṣṇa consciousness movement depended entirely upon him.
In December 1967 Śrīla Prabhupāda returned to America. His movement didn’t really begin until this return. His time was limited, and he had to accomplish his mission.
In 1968 Śrīla Prabhupāda had approximately fifty disciples and six ISKCON centers. By 1971, ISKCON had expanded to six hundred disciples and sixty-five centers.

Until Śrīla Prabhupāda began his preaching, Kṛṣṇa consciousness in its original purity had never been widely spread. Only full surrender to the Supreme can bring freedom from the laws of karma and repeated birth and death.
Śrīla Prabhupāda’s success was due to his being directly empowered by Kṛṣṇa. Yet his story is not one of automatic miracles, but of great endeavor and faith.
Śrīla Prabhupāda encountered opposition from governments, media, and even religionists, yet he persevered with the sublime tolerance and unflinching determination of a pure devotee.
By material standards it is extraordinary what Śrīla Prabhupāda accomplished at his age. He was truly a mahātmā, as described by Kṛṣṇa in the Bhagavad-gītā.
Lord Caitanya predicted, 'In every town and village the chanting of My name will be heard.' Śrīla Prabhupāda fulfilled this prophecy by spreading Kṛṣṇa consciousness worldwide.
Although others had failed to spread Kṛṣṇa consciousness outside India, Śrīla Prabhupāda succeeded where they had not, sending disciples worldwide to establish Kṛṣṇa centers.
Śrīla Prabhupāda had to continually travel to each temple, instructing his disciples, correcting their mistakes, and raising the standard of their Kṛṣṇa consciousness.
By his faith, selfless dedication, and blessings of Lord Caitanya, Śrīla Prabhupāda did what no one else could have done.
Only one empowered by Lord Kṛṣṇa can actually spread the chanting of Hare Kṛṣṇa around the world.

ref: Bhagavad-gītā 6.24 — Translation and Purport by Śrīla Prabhupāda

statements.statement:
sa niścayena yoktavyo
yogo ’nirviṇṇa-cetasā
saṅkalpa-prabhavān kāmāṁs
tyaktvā sarvān aśeṣataḥ
manasaivendriya-grāmaṁ
viniyamya samantataḥ

Translation:
One should engage oneself in the practice of yoga with determination and faith and not be deviated from the path. One should abandon, without exception, all material desires born of mental speculation and thus control all the senses on all sides by the mind.

Purport:
The yoga practitioner should be determined and should patiently prosecute the practice without deviation. One should be sure of success at the end and pursue this course with great perseverance, not becoming discouraged if there is any delay in the attainment of success. Success is sure for the rigid practitioner. Regarding bhakti-yoga, Rūpa Gosvāmī says:

utsāhān niścayād dhairyāt
tat-tat-karma-pravartanāt
saṅga-tyāgāt sato vṛtteḥ
ṣaḍbhir bhaktiḥ prasidhyati

“One can execute the process of bhakti-yoga successfully with full-hearted enthusiasm, perseverance and determination, by following the prescribed duties in the association of devotees and by engaging completely in activities of goodness.” (Upadeśāmṛta 3)

As for determination, one should follow the example of the sparrow who lost her eggs in the waves of the ocean. A sparrow laid her eggs on the shore of the ocean, but the big ocean carried away the eggs on its waves. The sparrow became very upset and asked the ocean to return her eggs. The ocean did not even consider her appeal. So the sparrow decided to dry up the ocean. She began to pick out the water in her small beak, and everyone laughed at her for her impossible determination. The news of her activity spread, and at last Garuḍa, the gigantic bird carrier of Lord Viṣṇu, heard it. He became compassionate toward his small sister bird, and so he came to see the sparrow. Garuḍa was very pleased by the determination of the small sparrow, and he promised to help. Thus Garuḍa at once asked the ocean to return her eggs lest he himself take up the work of the sparrow. The ocean was frightened at this, and returned the eggs. Thus the sparrow became happy by the grace of Garuḍa.

Similarly, the practice of yoga, especially bhakti-yoga in Kṛṣṇa consciousness, may appear to be a very difficult job. But if anyone follows the principles with great determination, the Lord will surely help, for God helps those who help themselves.
